poem:
Title: Notions of Guilt and Power 

A verdict etches,
in nine numbered hours,
an unprecedented wrinkle - 
in the skins of history.

An old power, a sitting echo, 
tried and tainted,
in the court's ripe judgement.

Biden's thread of hope,
snagged on verdict's thorn,
May yet find strength,
in the bowels of a fall.
